location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 349: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Camp Near Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell encloses a translation of a letter, dated 2 September 1850, from His Royal Highness Feerooz Meerza [Firouz Mirza Nosrat-ed-Dowleh], Prince Governor of Fars, to Hennell, written in response to three of Hennell's letters, on the following three subjects: an act of piracy which was committed upon a bugla [buggalow] belonging to Hajee Yacoob by inhabitants of Khirrah in 1845; the plunder of twelve loads of raisins belonging to Mr Malcolm by Khoda Kerrum Khan; a house in Shiraz which was mortgaged to Mr Mills, an English merchant, but which has recently been reoccupied.
